table.name: The deity is also possibly associated with...
table.value: The Sky, The Cosmos, The Endless Dark
Swine, Food and The Culinary, Labour
Tending to Fear, Comfort, Emotional Closeness

table.name: ...with an aesthetic of...
table.value: Being Incredibly Far and Incredibly Close

table.name: The deity has a fixed, singular appearance...
table.value: Affixed to a tree with nine nails through its fragile, frog-like body.
Vaguely-human mass of smoke and honeycombed muscle.
Silver-masked and bearlike and sodden, wailing to speak, crowned in rain.
A stone like a mouth with huge teeth drooling rainwater.
Like a cat and then several cats all at once and then a single cat again.
Helmet like a birdcage, head burnt and almost gone in a wreath of fire. No legs, instead seven eels and ten tentacles.
Magpie large as a horse, sour-smelling, foul bile all over its toothy beak.
Huge dancing pig with crafty eyes, fangs, a nasty laugh, a tongue like a snake.
Plaited beard to its waist, face is nothing but a single gasping, gaping mouth.
A pair, armored in silver and lead, one with a helmet of a withered elder, the other a grinning crocodilian.
Crusted in heavy layers of wax over plate mail. Has hundreds of candles burning atop its shoulders.
An owl-like bird, face-feathers in a trefoil, face spinning into eyes and then a skull and then back to an owl face.
A knot of roots pulling itself along just beneath the ground, tearing up earth.
Dogs with human hands and human grins and human teeth, whistling, cleaning their fingernails with thorns.
Flowers and dense thorns wrapped around prone bleached bones, fingers clutched in fervent prayer.
Cold grey fire and damp purple ashes, hands only half-corporeal reaching through the flames en masse.
Floating innards, arranged as a spiral, nerves drifting in the air behind it.
Shrouded figure, fifteen feet tall, strung with silent chimes and shuffling on its knees.
Head like a weeping willow, long body made of carved articulated wood like an armless puppet.
Shifting pyramidal tumor, blubbery, with trunk-like extremities.

table.name: The deity desires, and will cooperate in exchange for...
table.value: To write the book that ends everything; Ink and paper, print, letters, new and old language.
To consensually fuck itself to death; Aphrodisiacs, encouragements.
To distil rancid sunlight; Glass containers, fresh captured sunlight.
To pass on its divine nature to another; Experimental subjects, godgore, godflesh.
To read all that has been written; More books, dead writers, live librarians.
To collect samples of all possible life; Taxonomic records, tissue samples.
To be alone; A wide berth, very limited attention, very small requests.
To sleep forever; Powerful soporifics, cushions, permanent silence, eternal night.
To spread fecund life; Stem cells, mycelia, spores of itself, blood.
To destroy another deity; Divine trails or tracks, tactics, defiled divine icons, an infinity of weapons.
To find its lost extrasensory eyes; Physical eyeballs, optic nerves, non-light, anti-light, ghost photons.
To educate all sapient beings; Educated brains, large crowds and increasing attention.
To stop Time so it may get ahead; Clocks, hourglasses, evidence of chronology, fragments of the Arrow of Time.
To consume/be made a part of primordial flame; Refined fuels, primordial embers, the flame itself.
To consume another deity; Divine trails or tracks, divine iconography, fine seasoning, broth.
To unfix itself from space and time; Any records of its existence, your memories of it, your eyes.
To know absolutely everything; Increasingly fine, specific, interconnected information.
To tax names and having names and epistemology; Your real names, the real names of everyone you come across, reified personalities from names.
To categorize sin, call itself a sinner; New moral strictures, inquisitors, confessors, guidelines, depravities.
To escape into the unconscious world; Dreams themselves, the ability to sleep.

table.name: The deity is able to...
table.value: Retrace fates of the dead, drown people on land.
Combust whole cities, divine and reveal personal secrets.
Incite homicide, make enemies into allies for a time.
Reveal mysteries of still water, manifest and lead vast armies.
Steal treasures of other deities, ruin personal dignity.
Give answers to all esoterica, make people completely undetectable.
Make an individual loved by all, teach every single language.
Heal all infirmaries, manifest benevolent companions.
Reveal ancient treasures, incite positive emotions in people.
Place ideas into peopleâ€™s minds, reveal true personalities.
Cause earthquakes, evangelize its own divine nature.
Teach logic, ethics, moral relativism, and the process of eternal life.
Teach pyromancy, procure feuds, reconcile controversies.
Compel people to thievery, manifest trapped or cursed items.
Cause and heal afflictions, change the shape of humans.
Travel anywhere known or perceived, disconnect the soul from the body.
Induce laziness, vanity, and growing paranoia.
Destroy thoughts and memories, destroy past actions or results of actions.
Transmute metals into other metals, create sensory illusions.
Trade favors and debts from one person to another, teach divine nature.

table.name: The deity's nature and behavior is generally
If brought into contract or exchange, the deity maintains this taboo...
